content.text: fml4 -o (Formula Math Library - Form 4 Old Syllabus) is an interactive mathematics learning platform designed for Form 4 students. It combines precise calculations with AI-powered explanations to help you understand the entire Form 4 curriculum.
Every calculation comes with two views: 'Steps' for formal derivation and 'Lazyplain' for simple conceptual understanding.

items: Choose a chapter from the sidebar
Enter your values in the input fields
Click the solve/calculate button to see results
Toggle between 'Steps' and 'Lazyplain' to understand the logic
Try the AI Assist for natural language questions

content.title: Ch 1: Coordinate Geometry
content.description: Gradients, distance, midpoint, and line equations. Master the relationships between points and lines.

content.title: Ch 2: Areas & Perimeters
content.description: Calculate areas for triangles, quadrilaterals, polygons, and circles. Includes Heron's formula and similar shape scaling.

content.title: Ch 3: 3-Dimensional Figures
content.description: Interactive 3D visualizations of cylinders, cones, and spheres. Calculate surface areas and volumes.

content.title: Ch 4: Probability
content.description: Understand events, mutually exclusive vs independent events, and combined probability with visual meters.

content.title: Ch 5: Trigonometry
content.description: Master the Sine and Cosine rules. Solve complex triangle problems with dynamic Mafs visualizations.

content.title: Ch 6: Vectors
content.description: Learn magnitude, direction, and vector operations. Visual tip-to-tail addition.

content.title: Ch 7: Matrices
content.description: Determinants, inverses, and solving simultaneous equations using Cramer's Rule. Includes geometric transformations.

content.title: Ch 8: Linear Programming
content.description: Visualize inequality regions and optimize objective functions for real-world constraints.

content.text: The AI Assist feature allows you to ask math questions in natural language. It identifies the correct formula and provides a detailed breakdown.
Ask questions like: 'What is the volume of a cone with radius 3 and height 5?' or 'Solve 2x+y=10 and x+y=7'.
The AI is specifically trained on all 45+ tools in this library.
All calculations are performed locally in your browser. Your API key is stored in your private localStorage and is only sent to Groq's official API.
